title: [Scene2D] clipBegin potential NullPointerException
body:
This may not be a bug but may be worth having a look (probably by @NathanSweet). Since https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/cd336d6b0deaecae629955290c910f88eacf8f3e I'm seeing very rare/infrequent crash reports:

```

Fatal Exception: java.lang.NullPointerExceptionAttempt to invoke virtual method 'void com.badlogic.gdx.g.a.h.a(com.badlogic.gdx.math.n, com.badlogic.gdx.math.n)' on a null object reference Raw Text
--
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor.clipBegin + 818 (Actor.java:818)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.ScrollPane.draw + 595 (ScrollPane.java:595)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group.drawChildren + 123 (Group.java:123)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group.draw + 57 (Group.java:57)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group.drawChildren + 110 (Group.java:110)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group.draw + 57 (Group.java:57)
  | com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage.draw + 128 (Stage.java:128)

```

which seems to indicate `stage` is `null` when executing the clipping (no idea how that's possible as this is executed under `Stage.draw`).

It may be my setup but, would it make sense to add a null check to `stage` on `Actor#clipBegin()` or stage Must be not null when calling `draw()` on an Actor?

#### Reproduction steps/code
Wasn't able to reproduce

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.10-SNAPSHOT
